issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: All attempts at reproducing this issue failed, or not enough information was available to reproduce the issue. Reading the code produces no clues as to why this behavior would occur. If more information appears later, please reopen the issue.
resolution.name: Cannot Reproduce

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
For prioritization: Restarting the cloud seems to make this problem go away, and it's very intermittent.

During my testing of new CORS feature, a 1-node cloud I launched in the EQS 26-Jan-2016 failed to complete the Calyptos deployment step. 

An error from Calyptos before it timed out:

{noformat}
Tue Jan 26 12:19:58 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.        class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#49] START:DISABLED  arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.155:objectstorage:A        PI_10.111.5.155.objectstorage/ INITIALIZED->DISABLED=BROKEN [OSG object storage provider client not configured. Found property 'objectstorage.providerclient' empty or unset manager(null).  Legal values are: riakcs,walrus]
{noformat}

A little later:

{noformat}
Tue Jan 26 12:21:50 2016  INFO [StorageControllerBuilder:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:Futures.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#123] Firing LOAD for local config: one-sc-1
Tue Jan 26 12:21:50 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#43] CHECK:null  arn:euca:eucalyptus:o
ne:storage:one-sc-1/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [SC blockstoragemanager not configured. Found empty or unset manager(null).  Legal values are: das,ceph-rbd,overlay,equallogic,threepar,netapp]

Tue Jan 26 12:21:50 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#34] CHECK:null  arn:euca:bootstrap:AP
I_10.111.5.155:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.155.objectstorage/ BROKEN->DISABLED=BROKEN [OSG object storage provider client not configured. Found property 'objectstorage.providerclient' empty or unset manager(null).  
Legal values are: riakcs,walrus]

Tue Jan 26 12:21:52 2016  INFO [Component:Eucalyptus.node:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:cluster:node:com.eucalyptus.cluster.callback.ResourceStateCallback/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$
Worker#422] :1453839712485:Component:COMPONENT_SERVICE_REGISTERED:node:local:ServiceConfiguration node arn:euca:bootstrap:one:node:10.111.5.155/ 10.111.5.155:8775:/axis2/services/EucalyptusNC:host-local:INITIALIZED
Tue Jan 26 12:21:58 2016  INFO [Hosts:pool-5-thread-1] Updated changed local host entry: Host 10.111.5.155 #28 /10.111.5.155 coordinator=10.111.5.155 booted db started=1453839552601 [/10.107.105.155, /10.111.5.155]
Tue Jan 26 12:22:02 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.component.Topology-10.111.5.155-one-cc-1/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor
$Worker#290] ENABLE:ENABLED  arn:euca:eucalyptus:one:cluster:one-cc-1/ DISABLED->ENABLED=NOTREADY [null]

Tue Jan 26 12:22:08 2016  INFO [Hosts:pool-5-thread-18] Updated local host information:   Host 10.111.5.155 #29 /10.111.5.155 coordinator=10.111.5.155 booted db started=1453839552601 [/10.107.105.155, /10.111.5.155
]
Tue Jan 26 12:22:08 2016  INFO [Hosts:pool-5-thread-18] Updated changed local host entry: Host 10.111.5.155 #28 /10.111.5.155 coordinator=10.111.5.155 booted db started=1453839552601 [/10.107.105.155, /10.111.5.155
]
Tue Jan 26 12:22:20 2016 ERROR [Component:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#57] java.lang.NullPointerException
Tue Jan 26 12:22:20 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#57] CHECK:null  arn:euca:eucalyptus:o
ne:storage:one-sc-1/ DISABLED->DISABLED=NOTREADY [null]

Tue Jan 26 12:22:21 2016 ERROR [Component:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#44] java.lang.NullPointerException
Tue Jan 26 12:22:21 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#44] CHECK:null  arn:euca:bootstrap:AP
I_10.111.5.155:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.155.objectstorage/ DISABLED->DISABLED=NOTREADY [null]
{noformat}

Investigating with Swathi, she noticed NullPointerExceptions in attempted state transitions for the objectstorage service, such as:

{noformat}
Tue Jan 26 15:18:21 2016 ERROR [EXTREME:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#54] arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.15
5:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.155.objectstorage/ failed to transition because of:
OsgBootstrapper.enable( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstorage
Tue Jan 26 15:18:21 2016 ERROR [EXTREME:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#54] com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Transition
Exception: OsgBootstrapper.enable( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstorage
com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionException: OsgBootstrapper.enable( ): failed because of: null, terminating bootstrap for component: objectstorage
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.doTransition(Component.java:652)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.doTransition(Component.java:627)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.check(Component.java:773)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$ServiceLocalTransitionCallbacks$3.fire(ServiceTransitions.java:649)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.processTransition(ServiceTransitions.java:360)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.access$000(ServiceTransitions.java:123)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$TransitionActions.leave(ServiceTransitions.java:412)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions$TransitionActions.leave(ServiceTransitions.java:379)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.TransitionImpl.leave(TransitionImpl.java:218)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState$ActiveTransition.leave(AtomicMarkedState.java:524)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.afterLeave(AtomicMarkedState.java:342)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.AtomicMarkedState.transition(AtomicMarkedState.java:185)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceState.transition(ServiceState.java:136)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceState.transition(ServiceState.java:83)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:141)
        at com.eucalyptus.util.fsm.Automata$1.call(Automata.java:126)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.executeTransition(ServiceTransitions.java:317)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.ServiceTransitions.pathTo(ServiceTransitions.java:183)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java:1311)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.apply(Topology.java:1302)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$Transitions.apply(Topology.java:1274)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$Transitions.apply(Topology.java:1187)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$8.call(Topology.java:1153)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$8.call(Topology.java:1141)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue$EucaFutureTask.run(Threads.java:699)
        at com.eucalyptus.system.Threads$Queue.run(Threads.java:756)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:471)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:262)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1145)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:615)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.ObjectStorageGateway.check(ObjectStorageGateway.java:289)
        at com.eucalyptus.objectstorage.bootstrap.OsgBootstrapper.check(OsgBootstrapper.java:148)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition$7.runBootstrapper(Component.java:725)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition.apply(Component.java:734)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper$BootstrapperTransition$7.apply(Component.java:722)
        at com.eucalyptus.component.Component$ComponentBootstrapper.doTransition(Component.java:640)
        ... 31 more
{noformat}

Swathi has seen a similar pattern before, hard to reproduce. Paraphrasing from her on IRC: "The service state is not transitioning, but the reason is not the provider client configuration. I've seen something like this before where the state transition was tripping up on something, it was not easily reproducible either. I think this might be an intermittent issue that you accidentally hit, restarting the eucalyptus-cloud would bring things back to normal.  Error logs point to line 650 of Component.java which is where the exception is being logged. But its never supposed to get there if it was not initialized in the first place.  I think the state transition got into a weird state which triggered reloading of some of the classes where references to backends were already instantiated."

Reloading the class would set the static ospClient variable to null, after it was configured, resulting in the NPE here, higher in the call stack, in ObjectStorageGateway.java:

{code:java}
  public static void check() throws EucalyptusCloudException {
    LOG.trace("Checking ObjectStorageGateway");
    ospClient.check();
    LOG.trace("Checking ObjectStorageGateway complete");
  }
{code}

Investigation continues.
fields.summary: The objectstorage service never transitions to available on cloud startup

comments.body: If ObjectStorageGateway#ospClient is null when not started then ObjectStorageGateway#check should allow for that by not calling ospClient#check.
Add null checks and test check() invocation on component not started.

Where it was seen: http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/2492/

It was built from my dev-lincolnt-EUCA-11639-cors-feature branch with the latest from master merged in (so, basically the same thing as master 2 days later after I merged my branch in.) 

Topology was changed to be a 1-node cloud.

Will add null checks and investigate.

This may not be related - CC on a CentOS7 setup is stuck in NOT READY state. All eucalyptus components except NC are running on a single host. Snippet from error logs. 

{noformat}
Thu Jan 28 18:03:33 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#64] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topolog
y$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1324] START:DISABLED  arn:euca:eucalyptus:one:cluster:cc-10.111.5.77/ NOTREADY->DISABLED=NOTREADY [Cluster credentials are invalid: cc-10.111.5.77]
...
Thu Jan 28 18:04:24 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.cluster:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:eucalyptus::cluster:com.eucalyptus.component.Topology-10.111.5.77-cc-10.111.5.77/.class java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExe
cutor$Worker#436] [com.eucalyptus.component.Topology$TopologyChange.doTopologyChange(Topology.java):1324] ENABLE:ENABLED  arn:euca:eucalyptus:one:cluster:cc-10.111.5.77/ DISABLED->ENABLED=NOTREADY [null]
{noformat}

CC: [~shaon]
There were some changes recently for startup performance ( EUCA-11867 ) that could be related to these issues, please assign this to me if you'd like me to take a look.

Looks like the CC got enabled after I uploaded the network.json. I am skeptical about this behavior, we should probably error out that network mode is missing (perhaps in cc-fault.log) or never go into disabled state, whichever makes more sense.

Another change I found that is, {{cloud.network.network_configuration}} is not visible unless {{--edit}} is applied.
{noformat}
# euctl cloud.network.network_configuration
# euctl cloud.network
cloud.network.ec2_classic_additional_protocols_allowed =
cloud.network.global_max_network_index = 4096
cloud.network.global_max_network_tag = 4096
cloud.network.global_min_network_index = 2
cloud.network.global_min_network_tag = 1
cloud.network.min_broadcast_interval = 5
cloud.network.network_index_pending_timeout = 35
cloud.network.network_tag_pending_timeout = 35
{noformat}

Sorry, slightly off-topic, but I think, the reported issue is not application to this ticket anymore.
Added null pointer checks to configure / start / stop / check of ospClient. Doesn't fix anything, but we will see Warning and Error messages in the log files if it happens again.

Hi [~sjones],
Now that the extra null pointer checking code is in, assigning to you for now, per your comment:
"There were some changes recently for startup performance ( EUCA-11867 ) that could be related to these issues, please assign this to me if you'd like me to take a look."
Thanks!

My understanding was that we were changing the check method to log a warning but not fail when oscpClient was null. I'm not clear what the point of the change is if it only alters logging but does nothing to address the issue (/symptom)

I did attempt to look into into this, but was not able to reproduce the failure (I tested on cloud with ufs/clc/sc colocated)

If we know steps to reproduce the failure then please add them to this issue.

[~sjones]: We're not changing the behavior until we see it happen again with this logging, to understand how it gets into this situation which should never happen. The symptom is the "objectstorage" service never getting to "enabled" in the euserv-describe-services output. We don't want to lie in check(), and claim the "objectstorage" service is fine when it's not. If it's now legal for check() to be called before configure() has finished (say, in another thread), then we need to be able to distinguish that case from check() being called after it was configured and has been reset to null for some unknown reason. Then we need to handle those cases differently.

If you've already investigated if any of your code changes for EUCA-11867 could cause ospClient to be null in check(), and you haven't found anything, then OK to have assigned it back to me. If you have any other insight, do let us know. 
Thanks,
Lincoln

I can now easily reproduce this issue!

If you deploy a Quick Launch Master on CentOS7, and make a 1-node cluster, Calyptos fails because the objectstorage service never becomes "enabled". Errors are like:

{noformat}
Wed Mar 30 17:09:47 2016 ERROR [Topology:Eucalyptus.bootstrap:EphemeralConfiguration:arn:euca:bootstrap:Topology::external/.class 
java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker#57] START:DISABLED  
arn:euca:bootstrap:API_10.111.5.165:objectstorage:API_10.111.5.165.objectstorage/ NOTREADY->DISABLED=NOTREADY 
[ospClient is null in check(), OSG apparently not configured.]
{noformat}

The topology I entered into the Jenkins TOPOLOGY text box parameter to make a 1-node cloud was:

{noformat}
machine-topology:
  - cloud-components:
    - clc
    - walrus
    - cc
    - sc
    - ufs
    - console
    - nc
    cluster-name: one
{noformat}

I did it once with everything, including the eucaconsole and service image, and once without both of those. Same result.

They are both live and running now if anyone has a chance to investigate ([~swathi]?)

On the first one:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/3176/
I saw lots of the null OSG Client errors in the log files, until I restarted the service. Then they never re-appeared. But the services still don't start right because Calyptos failed and did not continue setting up the rest of the services.

On the second one:
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/3181/
I saw the same errors, and I have not restarted any services. I also caused a JVM thread dump ("kill -3" of the eucalyptus-cloud service PID).
I then copied all the log files to /var/log/eucalyptus/firstlogs/ so the originals wouldn't be rotated away.

I also launched a regular 3-node cluster, with no such issue.
So, why does this happen only the first time the eucalyptus-cloud service is started, and only on 1-node clouds?
[~spark], it looks like that functionality was added today, in which case it is not related to this issue.

[~spark], I introduced the configurable property {{objectstorage.s3provider.s3endpointheadresponse}} just yesterday. I did forget to commit the code that initializes its value in the upgrade path (@PrePersist and @PreUpdate annotations). I'm committing that right now. [~sjones] is right, this issue has been around even before the newly introduced property and may be unrelated.

Note: This is currently only reproducible on Centos 6 (no longer occurs on 7), only through QA/Calyptos installs (so far), only on single node installs, and only sometimes.

Edit: For reference, a successful single node centos6 install:

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/3819/
[~jhalterman] could you have a look if the issue is gone with the latest changes?

[~vasya] I just had two builds that were green, one of centos7 and one on 6.

http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/3890/
http://jenkins.qa1.eucalyptus-systems.com/job/Quick%20Launch%20Master/3891/

It's actually be a while since I've reproduced this bug. Will try once more...

We've decided to close this for now as it appears to no longer be reproducible. Being that this problem only appeared (as far as we were able to find) via Calyptos installs, it may have been fixed indirectly by other Calyptos changes or by other changes to Eucalyptus. If this problem re-appears, we should reopen this issue again, hopefully with better info on the problem.
